name: rotundly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(especially of a person) in a way that is round or rounded in shape: Simon was the rotundly cheerful Head of Human Resources, famous for his long lunches and longer speeches. The king would preside over the proceedings of court, seated rotundly in his throne.
More examplesFewer examplesThese fish are distinctive for being rotundly shaped, with large eyes and a big dorsal fin. Rotundly smiling, always with a smooth comment and willing to shake a hand, he was an archetypal candidate.
